candidates.title: Update actions, re-release for aarch64-apple-darwin
candidates.body:
This PR updates the actions for parity with the Makefile name for the compressed provider-archives and bumps each provider a patch version in order for us to re-release the provider with the `aarch64-apple-darwin` target.

This PR, once released, also fixes #72

candidates.title: Blobstore interface parity
candidates.body:
Fixes #63 

With our `widl` wrapper object changes, some of the parameters for the blobstore provider functions were not the same type as the interface specifies. This PR remediates that.

candidates.title: Brought telnet provider up to 0.15.0 standards
candidates.body:
Fixes #32, Fixes #12 

This PR brings the `telnet` provider up to `0.15.0` standards, including making use of the `telnet` actor interface, idempotent `bind` functionality, and properly removing listeners when actors are Removed.

Speaking to the last point, I wasn't able to get the `RemoveActor` op to be delivered to this provider. Perhaps @autodidaddict can shed some light on if this should happen when I run `wash ctl stop actor`, `wash ctl stop provider`, or if it only is delivered in another case.

candidates.title: bump httpclient version with new op
Update OP name and bump actor version
candidates.body: Aligning with 0.2.0 of actor

candidates.title: Blobstore provider update
candidates.body:
Both blobstore providers (fs, s3) needed to update to the blobstore interface version `0.2.0`, mostly just to return the `BlobstoreResult` for a few operations.

While I was updating and testing the s3 provider, I added in an option to use an HTTP proxy, which is common in enterprise AWS environments. This should not affect any existing configurations as it's strictly optional.

candidates.title: update actix2, crossbeam, log, wasmcloud-provider-core
candidates.body: related to wasmcloud actix2 upgrade

candidates.title: 🤬🤬🤬🤬
candidates.body: This version was still de-serializing the data as an event, not as a `WriteEventArgs`

candidates.title: Upgrading to the new eventstreams interface
Adding support for health check requests to streams and logging provi…
candidates.body: …ders

candidates.title: Redis streams update to 0.15.x
candidates.body: If you run the unit test in here, make sure you've got Redis running.

candidates.title: fix to #43 - subscriptions not getting delivered from messaging provider to actor
Bumping http server provider to use wasmcloud provider core
candidates.body: I blame you. For all of this.

candidates.title: Bumping NATS kvcache to provider core
candidates.body: When fixing clippy warnings in wasmcloud-host PR, decided to bump wasmcloud-host to use provider core instead of wascc-codec. This meant that I needed the NATS kvcache to use provider core ;)

candidates.title: Auto-updating README with crates.io versions, moved NATS comment
candidates.body:
Apparently, our script to grab the capability contract ID does not handle comments on the same line, so I moved the NATS comment up a line.

The main feature of this PR is `crates.io` badges for the latest versions in the readme, this ensures anyone who visits this repository can automatically see the latest published crate version. I threw in a snippet about the latest OCI tag, but the OCI reference is there at least without the tag. Curious if there are suggested improvements.

I've also trawled through our READMEs and removed some lingering `wascc` references, added crates.io badges, and standardized the format of the READMEs. This will make the crates.io page look similar for all the providers and show accurate information.

candidates.title: Upgrading nats capability provider to 0.15 standards
Updating 0.15 providers to actor interface pinned versions
candidates.body: This will allow us to re-release our capability providers, including a release to crates.io where they can be imported as libraries.

candidates.title: Updated logging provider to 0.15 compliance and interface versions
candidates.body:
PR incoming with all other providers updated to use interface versions.

This logging provider has been tested and verified to log messages that are logged in an actor, both using `write_log` directly and using log macros (e.g. `error!`, `info!`).

candidates.title: Http client 0.15
candidates.body:
- Updated to use http-client actor interface (will fail CI/CD since the interface isn't published yet)
- Updated tests accordingly
- Updated dependencies, namely Tokio `0.2` -> `1.1.1`

candidates.title: Update S3 to 0.15 compliance and blobstore actor interface
candidates.body:
Related to #12 

This updates the S3 provider to 0.15 compliance and using the `wasmcloud:blobstore` contract ID and actor interface.

I've confirmed that the previous test suite runs & passes, I've also included a `docker run` oneliner for future tests of this project because it took me a few minutes to track down the exact Minio server flags that I needed.

candidates.title: FS provider 0.15
candidates.body:
Updated FS provider to use `wasmCloud` terminology and the `blobstore` actor interface for its shared types.

Tests are passing alongside the `actor-interface` doctest. The badges in the README will likely be corrupted for the time being until we get this provider published onto crates.io.

Related to #12

candidates.title: Http-server & Redis 0.15.0 Updates
candidates.body:
Updates `http-server` provider and `redis` provider to 0.15.0 compliance by using generated data types from `actor-interfaces` and using the `wasmcloud:httpserver` and `wasmcloud:keyvalue` capability contract IDs, respectively. 

I have not addressed all concerns from #12, so I'm creating a Draft PR for now to check in my code. @autodidaddict I will reach out to you next week to make sure I know how to address the rest of the concerns there so I can convert this PR.

candidates.title: Redisgraph use actor interfaces
candidates.body: This PR uses the graphdb interface from https://github.com/wasmCloud/actor-interfaces/pull/20/files as well as the `actor-core` interface to rewrite the redisgraph provider and actor API.

candidates.title: Initial commit of NATS key-value replicated in-memory cache
Idempotent configuration binding and support for health checks
candidates.body:
0.15.x requires that all capability providers:
* Gracefully ignore attempts at binding actors that are already bound
* Support returning a health status in response to a health check

candidates.title: NATS Upgrade
candidates.body: Merging in commits from the upstream PR for upgrading NATS

candidates.title: Add Makefile to providers for par creation
candidates.body:
A Makefile at the root provides targets for copying the common Cross.toml and provider makefiles to all the providers.

This also adds a README.md indicating some basic usage and caveats on platform support.

chosen_pr.title: Update actions, re-release for aarch64-apple-darwin
chosen_pr.body:
This PR updates the actions for parity with the Makefile name for the compressed provider-archives and bumps each provider a patch version in order for us to re-release the provider with the `aarch64-apple-darwin` target.

This PR, once released, also fixes #72
